title: Pregnant British mum and fiance who drowned in Portugal pictured
text:

A pregnant British mum and her fiancé who drowned on holiday in Portugal have been pictured as friends and family pay tribute to the "beautiful souls".

Mum-of-two Kim Fletcher, 33, died alongside 34-year-old Danny Johnson who rushed into the sea to save her on Sunday after she got into difficulties.

The pair disappeared from view as they swam back to shore from the rocks Kim had been clinging to.

Nearby surfers went to the Stoke-on-Trent couple's aid and tried to revive them.

But tragically, they had already gone into cardiac arrest and were pronounced dead at the scene.

The devastating incident happened at around 2.30pm at Zambujeira do Mar in Portugal’s Alentejo region.

Danny's grieving cousin Bobby Johnson today told Mirror Online: "He taught me so much growing up and I just can't believe I'm never going to see him again."

(Image: Facebook)

The kind-hearted and spiritual couple, who travelled the world, both practised meditation and yoga regularly and "just loved life".

They had recently set up a meditation workshop to help other people enjoy and appreciate the world the same way they did and put smiles on faces.

Bobby, who thought of Danny like a brother, added: "Danny and Kim had been together for many years and they were honestly two of the most warm hearted people I've ever known.

"It's absolutely heartbreaking hearing the news. It's devastated the whole family and local community.

"They have impacted so many people's lives for the better."

Kim is understood to have been four months pregnant.

(Image: Facebook)

Her and Danny also have a four-year-old daughter together, and Kim is mum to a 15-year-old daughter too.

In one inspirational post on Facebook she wrote: "We must never wait to begin anything at all. Start where you are. Tomorrow never comes. Time waits for no one. Make it yours... today."

Ahead of her trip to Portugal she also posted: "Cannot wait for the Portuguese sunshine on my face."

The doting "free-spirited" parents have been described as "beautiful inside and out" and went above and beyond to spread joy, love and positivity.

Danny also went by the name Abhaya the Author and described himself as an author, rapper, poet and public speaker.

(Image: Facebook)

He wrote on his Facebook page: "It's a mixed bunch of talents, I know, but I wanted to bring them all together in one place to assist and help anybody on their own journey of personal and spiritual growth."

He offered advice from the heart, including opening up about his own battles in life, such as acceptance.

He told one friend: "It's a battle that we all face. The funny thing is that those that we are trying to find acceptance from are more than likely craving acceptance from us also.

"I found that writing in an appreciation diary every night about all of the things that I appreciate about my life and day helped me to start acknowledging all of the things that I loved about me and my life."

(Image: Facebook)

Cousin Bobby added: "Whenever i was going through a tough time, Danny would always be there to guide me and help me find clarity.

"I have so many memories that I'll cherish forever. Playing football and basketball over on the park. Creating music together with him and his brother Ben in my studio in the garden shed. We're all just heartbroken."

Close friend Steph Critchlow has also laid bare her pain at losing her two friends who were so "full of love".

In a heartrending tribute to Mirror Online, she said: "Kim and Danny, 2 beautiful souls, so full of gratitude and salt of the earth. I'm blessed to have known them.

(Image: Facebook)

"I met Kim and Danny in 2015 when our children were months old at baby massage, we connected instantly and ever since we stayed good friends.

"Once, Kim spent nine hours putting dreadlocks into my hair when the children were babies, though a little stressful as my son was a little wild, Kim's patience just shone through as it always did and with laughter and smiles she got the job done."

Steph continued: "They were full of love, love to the people and to the ground that they stood on and to be around them filled me with such content and fulfilment.

(Image: Facebook)

"In a world full of darkness, Kim and Danny found the light, they were the light and together they shone and everybody knew of it. Their love for each other was so strong.

"Kim found her yoga and spread the word of love and light through this to many. Danny started his writing and together they spent many time away on yoga retreats.

"As for the girls Aveyja - 4 years and Maicee 15 years, they gave their everything. Home educating was the way for them, they were such a loving family.

"As time went on and our lives grew we only saw each other occasionally, but we all kept in touch and spiritually we were always there.

(Image: Facebook)

"At such a tragic time right now, to remember them as they were, who they were and what they gave to many, it's so inspiring.

"Danny a hero, saving the love of his life. Kim recently shared this script, 'The planet doesn't need more successful people, the planet desperately needs more peacemakers, healers, restorers, storytellers and lovers of all kind - Dalai Lama'.

"That just describes them perfectly. I am truly heartbroken and I will miss them."

Friends have set up a fundraising page to cover funeral costs and a memorial, as well as provide for the couple's daughters.
description: EXCLUSIVE Tributes have been paid to "beautiful souls" Kim Fletcher, 33, and Danny Johnson, 34, from Stoke-on-Trent
